config.task_str:
You are a professional job search assistant. You need to manage a Notion page named `Job Finder` that contains a database called `Job Tracker` to track job application information.

For companies with status `Checking` that meet the following criteria:

- Minimum salary requirement > $3000
- Must be on-site work
- Company location within 500 km of UCLA
- Position is "software engineer" or "software manager"

send job application email using template: "Hi {Company Name}, I am Janet Mendoza, I want to apply for the {Position} position...", titled with "Job Application for {Position}" and update the Status of that entry to `Applied`.

system_prompts.agent:
Accessible workspace directory: /workspace/dumps/workspace
When processing tasks, if you need to read/write local files and the user provides a relative path, you need to combine it with the above workspace directory to get the complete path.
If you believe the task is completed, you can either call the `local-claim_done` tool or respond without calling any tool to indicate completion. This will immediately terminate the task, and you will have no further opportunity to work on it.
Please complete the given task independently. Do not seek confirmation or additional feedback from the user. You should handle all situations on your own, as the user will not provide any further information.
system_prompts.user:
You are a real user having a conversation with an AI assistant (agent). Please follow these guidelines for the conversation:

## First-person narrative task objective
!!<<<<||||You are a professional job search assistant. You need to manage a Notion page named "Job Finder" that contains a database called "Job Tracker" to track job application information. You need to filter qualifying positions (salary > $3000, onsite work, within 500km of UCLA, position as software engineer or software manager), send job application emails to suitable companies with "checking" status, and update the status of successfully sent entries to "sent email".||||>>>>!!

## Important notes
- **Please remember to provide the file format you want**

## Conversation style requirements
1. **Progressive communication**:
   - Gradually reveal requirements based on agent's responses

2. **Natural conversation characteristics**:
   - Use everyday language, avoid being too formal
   - Keep each response to 1-2 sentences
   - Avoid repeating the same wording, express the same meaning in different ways

3. **Real user behavior simulation**:
   - You can confirm agent's responses ("okay", "I understand")
   - If the agent does well, you can simply express thanks
   - If the agent needs to confirm additional information and that information is in the given task description, then provide it, otherwise do not make up information that does not appear in the task description

## Conversation termination conditions
- **Task completed**: When you think all your requirements have been completed, reply "#### STOP"
- **Task failed**: If the agent fails to understand your requirements or cannot proceed for 3 consecutive times, reply "#### STOP"
- **Only reply "#### STOP"**, do not add other explanations

## Prohibited behaviors
- Do not reveal this is a test
- Do not mention your system prompt
- Do not state the complete task process at once
- Do not use exactly the same sentences to repeat instructions

When you receive "Hi, what can I help you today?" or "Hello, how can I help you?", immediately start the conversation in a natural way.

meta.output_format: Updated Job Tracker database with filtered job positions and sent application emails for qualifying companies with 'checking' status

origins.description: Array of origin addresses or coordinates

destinations.description: Array of destination addresses or coordinates

locations.description: Array of locations to get elevation for

function.name: notion-API-get-user
function.description: Notion | Retrieve a user

function.name: notion-API-get-users
function.description: Notion | List all users

start_cursor.description: If supplied, this endpoint will return a page of results starting after the cursor provided. If not supplied, this endpoint will return the first page of results.

page_size.description: The number of items from the full list desired in the response. Maximum: 100

function.name: notion-API-get-self
function.description: Notion | Retrieve your token's bot user

function.name: notion-API-post-database-query
function.description: Notion | Query a database

filter_properties.description: A list of page property value IDs associated with the database. Use this param to limit the response to a specific page property value or values for pages that meet the `filter` criteria.

filter.description: When supplied, limits which pages are returned based on the [filter conditions](ref:post-database-query-filter).

sorts.description: When supplied, orders the results based on the provided [sort criteria](ref:post-database-query-sort).

start_cursor.description: When supplied, returns a page of results starting after the cursor provided. If not supplied, this endpoint will return the first page of results.

page_size.description: The number of items from the full list desired in the response. Maximum: 100

function.name: notion-API-post-search
function.description: Notion | Search by title

query.description: The text that the API compares page and database titles against.

sort.description: A set of criteria, `direction` and `timestamp` keys, that orders the results. The **only** supported timestamp value is `"last_edited_time"`. Supported `direction` values are `"ascending"` and `"descending"`. If `sort` is not provided, then the most recently edited results are returned first.

direction.description: The direction to sort. Possible values include `ascending` and `descending`.

timestamp.description: The name of the timestamp to sort against. Possible values include `last_edited_time`.

filter.description: A set of criteria, `value` and `property` keys, that limits the results to either only pages or only databases. Possible `value` values are `"page"` or `"database"`. The only supported `property` value is `"object"`.

value.description: The value of the property to filter the results by.  Possible values for object type include `page` or `database`.  **Limitation**: Currently the only filter allowed is `object` which will filter by type of object (either `page` or `database`)

property.description: The name of the property to filter by. Currently the only property you can filter by is the object type.  Possible values include `object`.   Limitation: Currently the only filter allowed is `object` which will filter by type of object (either `page` or `database`)

start_cursor.description: A `cursor` value returned in a previous response that If supplied, limits the response to results starting after the `cursor`. If not supplied, then the first page of results is returned. Refer to [pagination](https://developers.notion.com/reference/intro#pagination) for more details.

page_size.description: The number of items from the full list to include in the response. Maximum: `100`.

function.name: notion-API-get-block-children
function.description: Notion | Retrieve block children

start_cursor.description: If supplied, this endpoint will return a page of results starting after the cursor provided. If not supplied, this endpoint will return the first page of results.

page_size.description: The number of items from the full list desired in the response. Maximum: 100

function.name: notion-API-patch-block-children
function.description: Notion | Append block children

block_id.description: Identifier for a [block](ref:block). Also accepts a [page](ref:page) ID.

children.description: Child content to append to a container block as an array of [block objects](ref:block)

after.description: The ID of the existing block that the new block should be appended after.

function.name: notion-API-retrieve-a-block
function.description: Notion | Retrieve a block

function.name: notion-API-update-a-block
function.description: Notion | Update a block

type.description: The [block object `type`](ref:block#block-object-keys) value with the properties to be updated. Currently only `text` (for supported block types) and `checked` (for `to_do` blocks) fields can be updated.

archived.description: Set to true to archive (delete) a block. Set to false to un-archive (restore) a block.

function.name: notion-API-delete-a-block
function.description: Notion | Delete a block

function.name: notion-API-retrieve-a-page
function.description: Notion | Retrieve a page

filter_properties.description: A list of page property value IDs associated with the page. Use this param to limit the response to a specific page property value or values. To retrieve multiple properties, specify each page property ID. For example: `?filter_properties=iAk8&filter_properties=b7dh`.

function.name: notion-API-patch-page
function.description: Notion | Update page properties

page_id.description: The identifier for the Notion page to be updated.

properties.description: The property values to update for the page. The keys are the names or IDs of the property and the values are property values. If a page property ID is not included, then it is not changed.

in_trash.description: Set to true to delete a block. Set to false to restore a block.

icon.description: A page icon for the page. Supported types are [external file object](https://developers.notion.com/reference/file-object) or [emoji object](https://developers.notion.com/reference/emoji-object).

cover.description: A cover image for the page. Only [external file objects](https://developers.notion.com/reference/file-object) are supported.

function.name: notion-API-post-page
function.description: Notion | Create a page

children.description: The content to be rendered on the new page, represented as an array of [block objects](https://developers.notion.com/reference/block).

icon.description: The icon of the new page. Either an [emoji object](https://developers.notion.com/reference/emoji-object) or an [external file object](https://developers.notion.com/reference/file-object)..

cover.description: The cover image of the new page, represented as a [file object](https://developers.notion.com/reference/file-object).

function.name: notion-API-create-a-database
function.description: Notion | Create a database

properties.description: Property schema of database. The keys are the names of properties as they appear in Notion and the values are [property schema objects](https://developers.notion.com/reference/property-schema-object).

function.name: notion-API-update-a-database
function.description: Notion | Update a database

title.description: An array of [rich text objects](https://developers.notion.com/reference/rich-text) that represents the title of the database that is displayed in the Notion UI. If omitted, then the database title remains unchanged.

description.description: An array of [rich text objects](https://developers.notion.com/reference/rich-text) that represents the description of the database that is displayed in the Notion UI. If omitted, then the database description remains unchanged.

properties.description: Property schema of database. The keys are the names of properties as they appear in Notion and the values are [property schema objects](https://developers.notion.com/reference/property-schema-object).

function.name: notion-API-retrieve-a-database
function.description: Notion | Retrieve a database

database_id.description: An identifier for the Notion database.

function.name: notion-API-retrieve-a-page-property
function.description: Notion | Retrieve a page property item

page_size.description: For paginated properties. The max number of property item objects on a page. The default size is 100

function.name: notion-API-retrieve-a-comment
function.description: Notion | Retrieve comments

block_id.description: Identifier for a Notion block or page

start_cursor.description: If supplied, this endpoint will return a page of results starting after the cursor provided. If not supplied, this endpoint will return the first page of results.

page_size.description: The number of items from the full list desired in the response. Maximum: 100

function.name: notion-API-create-a-comment
function.description: Notion | Create comment

parent.description: The page that contains the comment

function.name: playwright_with_chunk-browser_close
function.description: Close the page

function.name: playwright_with_chunk-browser_resize
function.description: Resize the browser window

function.name: playwright_with_chunk-browser_console_messages
function.description: Returns all console messages

function.name: playwright_with_chunk-browser_handle_dialog
function.description: Handle a dialog

promptText.description: The text of the prompt in case of a prompt dialog.

function.name: playwright_with_chunk-browser_evaluate
function.description: Evaluate JavaScript expression on page or element
() => { /* code */ } or (element) => { /* code */ } when element is provided

element.description: Human-readable element description used to obtain permission to interact with the element

ref.description: Exact target element reference from the page snapshot

function.name: playwright_with_chunk-browser_file_upload
function.description: Upload one or multiple files

paths.description: The absolute paths to the files to upload. Can be a single file or multiple files.

function.name: playwright_with_chunk-browser_install
function.description: Install the browser specified in the config. Call this if you get an error about the browser not being installed.

function.name: playwright_with_chunk-browser_press_key
function.description: Press a key on the keyboard

key.description: Name of the key to press or a character to generate, such as `ArrowLeft` or `a`

function.name: playwright_with_chunk-browser_type
function.description: Type text into editable element

element.description: Human-readable element description used to obtain permission to interact with the element

ref.description: Exact target element reference from the page snapshot

text.description: Text to type into the element

submit.description: Whether to submit entered text (press Enter after)

slowly.description: Whether to type one character at a time. Useful for triggering key handlers in the page. By default entire text is filled in at once.

function.name: playwright_with_chunk-browser_navigate
function.description: Navigate to a URL

function.name: playwright_with_chunk-browser_navigate_back
function.description: Go back to the previous page

function.name: playwright_with_chunk-browser_navigate_forward
function.description: Go forward to the next page

function.name: playwright_with_chunk-browser_network_requests
function.description: Returns all network requests since loading the page

function.name: playwright_with_chunk-browser_take_screenshot
function.description: Take a screenshot of the current page. You can't perform actions based on the screenshot, use browser_snapshot for actions.

raw.description: Whether to return without compression (in PNG format). Default is false, which returns a JPEG image.

filename.description: File name to save the screenshot to. Defaults to `page-{timestamp}.{png|jpeg}` if not specified.

element.description: Human-readable element description used to obtain permission to screenshot the element. If not provided, the screenshot will be taken of viewport. If element is provided, ref must be provided too.

ref.description: Exact target element reference from the page snapshot. If not provided, the screenshot will be taken of viewport. If ref is provided, element must be provided too.

fullPage.description: When true, takes a screenshot of the full scrollable page, instead of the currently visible viewport. Cannot be used with element screenshots.

function.name: playwright_with_chunk-browser_snapshot
function.description: Capture accessibility snapshot of the current page. The snapshot is divided into manageable spans (configurable via --span-size, default 2000 characters, or use -1 to show complete snapshot) and shows the first span by default. Use browser_snapshot_navigate_* tools to view other spans or browser_snapshot_search to find content across all spans. This provides structured element data with ref attributes for interaction, making it better than screenshots for automation.

function.name: playwright_with_chunk-browser_click
function.description: Perform click on a web page

element.description: Human-readable element description used to obtain permission to interact with the element

ref.description: Exact target element reference from the page snapshot

doubleClick.description: Whether to perform a double click instead of a single click

button.description: Button to click, defaults to left

function.name: playwright_with_chunk-browser_drag
function.description: Perform drag and drop between two elements

startElement.description: Human-readable source element description used to obtain the permission to interact with the element

startRef.description: Exact source element reference from the page snapshot

endElement.description: Human-readable target element description used to obtain the permission to interact with the element

endRef.description: Exact target element reference from the page snapshot

function.name: playwright_with_chunk-browser_hover
function.description: Hover over element on page

element.description: Human-readable element description used to obtain permission to interact with the element

ref.description: Exact target element reference from the page snapshot

function.name: playwright_with_chunk-browser_select_option
function.description: Select an option in a dropdown

element.description: Human-readable element description used to obtain permission to interact with the element

ref.description: Exact target element reference from the page snapshot

values.description: Array of values to select in the dropdown. This can be a single value or multiple values.

function.name: playwright_with_chunk-browser_snapshot_navigate_to_span
function.description: Navigate to a specific span in the current page snapshot by index. Each span contains a portion of the page content (limited by span size). Use this when you know the exact span number you want to view, typically after using browser_snapshot_search to locate content.

spanIndex.description: The span index to navigate to (0-based)

function.name: playwright_with_chunk-browser_snapshot_navigate_to_first_span
function.description: Navigate to the first span of the current page snapshot. This shows the beginning of the page content and is useful for starting from the top of the page when exploring content sequentially.

function.name: playwright_with_chunk-browser_snapshot_navigate_to_last_span
function.description: Navigate to the last span of the current page snapshot. This shows the end of the page content and is useful for accessing footer content, final form elements, or bottom navigation.

function.name: playwright_with_chunk-browser_snapshot_navigate_to_next_span
function.description: Navigate to the next span in the current page snapshot. If already at the last span, stays at the last span. Use this for sequential exploration of page content from top to bottom.

function.name: playwright_with_chunk-browser_snapshot_navigate_to_prev_span
function.description: Navigate to the previous span in the current page snapshot. If already at the first span, stays at the first span. Use this for sequential exploration of page content from bottom to top.

function.name: playwright_with_chunk-browser_snapshot_navigate_to_line
function.description: Navigate to a specific global line number in the current page snapshot with configurable surrounding context lines. Shows which spans contain the context lines. The target line is marked with ">>>". Use this to quickly jump to specific content found via search results.

globalLineNumber.description: The global line number to navigate to (1-based)

contextLines.description: Number of context lines to show before and after the target line (default: 3)

function.name: playwright_with_chunk-browser_snapshot_search
function.description: Search for a pattern across all spans of the current page snapshot using regular expressions. Returns matches with both global line numbers (across entire snapshot) and in-span line numbers (within each span). Shows which spans contain matches for navigation. Supports regex flags like "gi" for global case-insensitive search.

pattern.description: The regex pattern to search for

flags.description: Optional regex flags (e.g., "gi" for global case-insensitive)

function.name: playwright_with_chunk-browser_tab_list
function.description: List browser tabs

function.name: playwright_with_chunk-browser_tab_new
function.description: Open a new tab

url.description: The URL to navigate to in the new tab. If not provided, the new tab will be blank.

function.name: playwright_with_chunk-browser_tab_select
function.description: Select a tab by index

index.description: The index of the tab to select

function.name: playwright_with_chunk-browser_tab_close
function.description: Close a tab

index.description: The index of the tab to close. Closes current tab if not provided.

function.name: playwright_with_chunk-browser_wait_for
function.description: Wait for text to appear or disappear or a specified time to pass

time.description: The time to wait in seconds

textGone.description: The text to wait for to disappear

function.name: emails-get_emails
function.description:
Get paginated list of emails from specified folder

Args:
    folder: Email folder name (default: INBOX)
    page: Page number starting from 1 (default: 1)
    page_size: Number of emails per page (default: 20)

function.name: emails-read_email
function.description:
Read full content of a specific email

Args:
    email_id: Email ID to read

function.name: emails-search_emails
function.description:
Search emails with query string (sorted by date descending)

Args:
    query: Search query (subject, from, body content)
    folder: Folder to search in (default: INBOX)
    page: Page number starting from 1 (default: 1)
    page_size: Number of results per page (default: 20)

function.name: emails-send_email
function.description:
Send an email with optional HTML body, CC, BCC, and attachments

Args:
    to: Recipient email address(es), comma-separated
    subject: Email subject
    body: Plain text body
    html_body: HTML body content (optional)
    cc: CC recipients, comma-separated (optional)
    bcc: BCC recipients, comma-separated (optional)
    attachments: List of file paths to attach (optional)

function.name: emails-reply_email
function.description:
Reply to an email

Args:
    email_id: ID of email to reply to
    body: Reply message body (plain text)
    html_body: Reply message body (HTML, optional)
    cc: Additional CC recipients (optional)
    bcc: BCC recipients (optional)
    reply_all: Whether to reply to all recipients (default: False)

function.name: emails-forward_email
function.description:
Forward an email to other recipients

Args:
    email_id: ID of email to forward
    to: Recipients to forward to
    body: Additional message body (optional)
    html_body: Additional HTML message body (optional)
    cc: CC recipients (optional)
    bcc: BCC recipients (optional)

function.name: emails-delete_email
function.description:
Delete an email

Args:
    email_id: Email ID to delete

function.name: emails-move_email
function.description:
Move email to another folder

Args:
    email_id: Email ID to move
    target_folder: Target folder name

function.name: emails-mark_emails
function.description:
Mark multiple emails with status (read/unread/important/not_important)

Args:
    email_ids: List of email IDs to mark
    status: Status to set (read, unread, important, not_important)

function.name: emails-move_emails
function.description:
Move multiple emails to another folder with improved ID synchronization

Args:
    email_ids: List of email IDs to move
    target_folder: Target folder name

function.name: emails-delete_emails
function.description:
Delete multiple emails with improved ID synchronization

Args:
    email_ids: List of email IDs to delete

function.name: emails-get_folders
function.description: Get list of available email folders

function.name: emails-create_folder
function.description:
Create new email folder

Args:
    folder_name: Name of folder to create

function.name: emails-delete_folder
function.description:
Delete email folder

Args:
    folder_name: Name of folder to delete

function.name: emails-get_mailbox_stats
function.description:
Get mailbox statistics

Args:
    folder_name: Specific folder name (optional, defaults to all folders)

function.name: emails-get_unread_count
function.description:
Get unread message count

Args:
    folder_name: Specific folder name (optional, defaults to all folders)

function.name: emails-check_connection
function.description: Check email server connection status

function.name: emails-get_email_headers
function.description:
Get complete email headers for technical analysis

Args:
    email_id: Email ID to get headers for

function.name: emails-save_draft
function.description:
Save email draft

Args:
    subject: Email subject
    body: Plain text body
    html_body: HTML body content (optional)
    to: Recipient email address(es) (optional)
    cc: CC recipients (optional)
    bcc: BCC recipients (optional)

function.name: emails-get_drafts
function.description:
Get list of saved drafts

Args:
    page: Page number starting from 1 (default: 1)
    page_size: Number of drafts per page (default: 20)

function.name: emails-update_draft
function.description:
Update existing draft

Args:
    draft_id: Draft ID to update
    subject: Email subject (optional)
    body: Plain text body (optional)
    html_body: HTML body content (optional)
    to: Recipient email address(es) (optional)
    cc: CC recipients (optional)
    bcc: BCC recipients (optional)

function.name: emails-delete_draft
function.description:
Delete draft

Args:
    draft_id: Draft ID to delete

function.name: emails-export_emails
function.description:
Export emails to file for backup

Args:
    folder: Specific folder to export (mutually exclusive with export_all_folders)
    export_path: Path where to save the export file  
    max_emails: Maximum number of emails to export (optional, exports all if not specified)
    export_all_folders: Export from all folders instead of just one (default: False)

function.name: emails-import_emails
function.description:
Import emails from backup file to IMAP server

Args:
    import_path: Path to import file (.json or .eml) or a directory
    target_folder: Target folder for imported emails (if preserve_folders=False)
    preserve_folders: Whether to preserve original folder structure (default: True)

function.name: emails-download_attachment
function.description:
Download email attachment to configured download path

Args:
    email_id: Email ID containing the attachment
    attachment_filename: Name of attachment to download

function.name: local-claim_done
function.description: claim the task is done

function.name: local-search_overlong_tooloutput
function.description: Search within overlong tool output content using regex patterns and return first page with session ID

shortuuid.description: The shortuuid identifier for the overlong tool output

pattern.description: The regex pattern to search for in the content

page_size.description: Number of matches per page (default: 10, max: 50)

context_size.description: Characters of context around each match (default: 1000)

function.name: local-search_overlong_tooloutput_navigate
function.description: Navigate through search results using search session ID

search_session_id.description: The search session ID returned from search_overlong_tool

target_page.description: Target page number (required for jump_to_page action)

function.name: local-view_overlong_tooloutput
function.description: View overlong tool output content with pagination and return first page with session ID

shortuuid.description: The shortuuid identifier for the overlong tool output

page_size.description: Number of characters per page (default: 10000, max: 100000)

function.name: local-view_overlong_tooloutput_navigate
function.description: Navigate through view content using view session ID

view_session_id.description: The view session ID returned from view_overlong_tool

target_page.description: Target page number (required for jump_to_page action)

function.name: local-check_context_status
function.description: Query current conversation context status, including turn statistics, token usage, truncation history and other information

function.name: local-manage_context
function.description:
Manage conversation context by deleting historical messages to free up space. Supports multiple strategies:
- keep_recent_turns: Keep the most recent N turns of conversation
- keep_recent_percent: Keep the most recent X% of conversation  
- delete_first_turns: Delete the earliest N turns of conversation
- delete_first_percent: Delete the earliest X% of conversation

action.description: Operation to execute, currently only supports truncate

value.description: Numeric parameter, for turns methods it's number of turns, for percent methods it's percentage (0-100)

function.name: local-smart_context_truncate
function.description:
Smart context truncation tool that precisely controls retained content by specifying ranges.
Accepts 2D list [[start1,end1],[start2,end2],...,[startN,endN]], each sublist represents a closed range to retain (both ends included).
Indexing starts from 0, ranges cannot overlap, must be arranged in order.

ranges.description: List of ranges to retain, format: [[start1,end1],[start2,end2],...], indexing starts from 0

function.name: local-search_history
function.description: Search history conversation records. Support multiple keyword search or regular expression search, return records containing all keywords. Support paging to browse all results.

keywords.description: Search keyword list or regular expression list, will find records matching all patterns

use_regex.description: Whether to treat keywords as regular expressions

function.name: local-view_history_turn
function.description: View the complete conversation content of a specific turn, including the context of previous and subsequent turns. Support content truncation to view long content.

context_turns.description: Display the context of previous and subsequent turns

truncate.description: Whether to truncate long content (keep the first 500 and last 500 characters)

function.name: local-browse_history
function.description: Browse history records in chronological order, support forward or backward browsing. Can choose whether to truncate long content.

direction.description: Browse direction: forward from early to late, backward from late to early

truncate.description: Whether to truncate long content display

function.name: local-history_stats
function.description: Get statistics of history records, including total turns, time range, message type distribution, etc.

function.name: local-search_in_turn
function.description: Search content within a specific turn, support regular expressions. Used to find specific information in long content (such as tool output).

jump_to.description: Jump to: 'first'(first page), 'last'(last page), 'next'(next page), 'prev'(previous page), or specific page number

messages.content:
You are a professional job search assistant. You need to manage a Notion page named `Job Finder` that contains a database called `Job Tracker` to track job application information.

For companies with status `Checking` that meet the following criteria:

- Minimum salary requirement > $3000
- Must be on-site work
- Company location within 500 km of UCLA
- Position is "software engineer" or "software manager"

send job application email using template: "Hi {Company Name}, I am Janet Mendoza, I want to apply for the {Position} position...", titled with "Job Application for {Position}" and update the Status of that entry to `Applied`.
